intro: Hypoxis villosa var. fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed yellowstar, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with a distinctive fringed appearance. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to full sun conditions. Its leaves are grass-like and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
